intro: Herniaria scaberrima, commonly known as the rough herniaria, is a small, mat-forming perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It features a low-growing habit with densely packed, fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Its root system is extensive and adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Herniaria scaberrima is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing the soil and preventing erosion.
